Eifel Natural Park.name: Eifel Natural Park
Eifel Natural Park.contacts: booking and advice center reachable by phone on 02441 994570 or directly at Nordeifel Tourismus GmbH
Eifel Natural Park.description: You can pitch your tent in the Eifel Natural Park, in North Rhine-Westphalia, legally. The park offers multiple natural camping locations and you can select yours during the booking phase. Each natural camp site is equipped with a composting toilet and offers space for up to two tents on a tent platform. All locations are only accessible on foot via hiking trails. You are on your own and you have to bring your own food. It is not possible to camp in winter, from November 1st until March 31st.

Barmstedt - Wildes.name: Barmstedt - Wildes
Barmstedt - Wildes.description: This overnight place is kindly offered by private owners and is located a little outside of Barmstedt on a large, quiet and natural private property. Sanitary rooms are not available. Pre-registration is not necessary.

Blomnath - Wildes.name: Blomnath - Wildes
Blomnath - Wildes.description: This area is near Blomnat, part ​​the Nature Conservation Foundation and offered by Ulrike and Jürgen Kaldewey from Seedorf. It is required to book for an overnight stay via email or phone.

Drage - Wildes.name: Drage - Wildes
Drage - Wildes.contacts: the provider of the overnight accommodation, Ms. Ute Gröne, can be reached at 04881-7797
Drage - Wildes.description: This place is in a 2500 square meter orchard in Drage. There are benches and tables and bicycles can be stored in a shed if necessary. A washroom with toilet and a shower are in the house but can be reached from outside through a separate entrance. This place is only 1.5 kilometers away from a swimming area and a canoe insertion point on the Eider. Booking via phone is required.

Eidertal - Wildes.name: Eidertal - Wildes
Eidertal - Wildes.description: This area, located in the Eider Valley, is surrounded by bushes and it is near a railway and a hiking trail. The vegetation and a the uneven ground offer a protection from the wind. Sanitary rooms are not available. It is not necessary to register in advance to camp on the area.

Enge-Sande - Wildes.name: Enge-Sande - Wildes
Enge-Sande - Wildes.description: This place is located at the edge of the Langenberger Forst state forest near the municipality of Enge-Sande. A farm road leads from Enger-Strasse up into the forest. The small camping area, is surrounded by both old and young trees and has a view of arable land and of the village. About 100m away there is a small pond that usually has water. There are no sanitary rooms. Registration is not required.

Trappenkamp Adventure Forest - Wildes.name: Trappenkamp Adventure Forest - Wildes
Trappenkamp Adventure Forest - Wildes.description: This place is publicly accessible and located in the area of ​​the Trappenkamp adventure forest. The site is accessible also when the Trappenkamp Adventure Forest's is closed. No booking is required.

Gieselau valley - Wildes.name: Gieselau valley - Wildes
Gieselau valley - Wildes.description: This place is publicly accessible and located in the area of ​​the Stone Age Park in Albersdorf. The replica of the large stone grave of Frestedt can also be found here. There are no sanitary rooms available. Registration is not required.

Gruber See - Wildes.name: Gruber See - Wildes
Gruber See - Wildes.contacts: phone (+494364471866) and email (post@meeresbrise.de). Contact in advance required.
Gruber See - Wildes.description: This place is in a farm where the owners are happy to offer the opportunity to pitch a tent for one night. The Mönchsweg, the international long-distance cycle path from Bremen to the Baltic Sea island of Fehmarn, is just next to the farm. For each stay, registration by phone or email is required.
Gruber See - Wildes.accessibility: This place is only available for bicycle travellers

Hattstedt - Wildes.name: Hattstedt - Wildes
Hattstedt - Wildes.contacts: for any questions contact 0175 7494094 or just drop by
Hattstedt - Wildes.description: This is a private campsite located in a yard in Hattstedt-Feld, 4 km north of Husum, near the North Sea Cycle Route and the Schobüller Forest. A compost toilet, tap and fireplace are available and may be used.

Hessenstein - Wildes.name: Hessenstein - Wildes
Hessenstein - Wildes.description: This place is an open space near a old quarry, right on the hiking trail. It is provided by the Nature Conservation Foundation in the Hessenstein Foundation State. Attractions such as the Tower Hill Castle and the Ice Age Museum are nearby.
Hessenstein - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (the sites are aimed exclusively at hikers or cyclists, parking vehicles is not allowed)

Husby - Wildes.name: Husby - Wildes
Husby - Wildes.description: This place is provided by the Danish scouts from Husby. The site is located near a pond and has also a shelter as a covered overnight accommodation, so it can also be used without a tent. There are no toilets available and there is a fire place with seating that can be used carefully but with your own wood.

Kolonistenhof - Wildes.name: Kolonistenhof - Wildes
Kolonistenhof - Wildes.description: This place is located at the edge of the Hüttener Berge, an nice area of ​​around 18 hectares with hiking trails. Nature lovers who would like to spend a night under the starry sky have the opportunity to spend the night here. The total camping area is of ​​approx. 500 m² and is located behind the baking house, the first building to the right of the entrance. Sanitary facilities are available.

Koppelheck - Wildes.name: Koppelheck - Wildes
Koppelheck - Wildes.description: This place, provided by the Schleswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation, is right on the Baltic Sea Cycle Route. It is a small area between two pastures, directly behind the dike, from which it is possible to enjoy the sea view.
Koppelheck - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (no access via the north street, you can get to the bike/hiking trail north via the beach car park in Ohrfeldhaff or east at Geltingmole)

Kosel - Wildes.name: Kosel - Wildes
Kosel - Wildes.description: This place is a little outside of Kosel, on a hiking trail near forests between a pasture and a dog free run area. The landscape is excellent for observing animals such as deer, fallow deer, hares, the eagle owl, black woodpecker and kingfisher. In the village there is a shop where you can stock up on essentials. There is a small swimming area at the Bültsee, right in the nature reserve, and another a swimming area on the Schlei. This place is kindly offered by Thiemo Florek from Kosel and it is not necessary to register for the overnight stay.

Kuden - Wildes.name: Kuden - Wildes
Kuden - Wildes.description: This place is on the area of ​​the former waterworks offered by the municipality of Kuden, as part of the Wild Schleswig-Holstein project. Registration is not required and the campsite can be freely chosen on the area. Sanitary rooms are not available.
Kuden - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (the area can be entered from the street Am Wasserwerk via a gate)

Mönchneversdorf - Wildes.name: Mönchneversdorf - Wildes
Mönchneversdorf - Wildes.contacts: by email: info@ferienhof-schnoor.de or by phone: 04528/846 (Dirk and Alexandra Schnoor)
Mönchneversdorf - Wildes.description: This space is part of the Schnoor holiday farm, directly below Bungsberg, between Mönchneversdorf and Kirchmühlen. You can camp in the pasture and if the weather is bad, you can stay overnight on hay and straw in the horse stable. The place is next to the European hiking trail and near lakes, ponds and forests. Many different animals live on site: horses, ponies, a donkey, 2 pigs, 2 goats, Eddi the dog, chickens, Johannes the rooster, rabbits, guinea pigs and some cats. Fishing is also possible in the area. Prior registration is required.

Olendieksau - Wildes.name: Olendieksau - Wildes
Olendieksau - Wildes.description: This overnight place is offered by the Schleswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation. The site is located directly on a hiking trail with a view of the pastures. There is a small wooden seating area on site. There is also a fence that carries a relatively strong current - please do not touch it! As a possible excursion destination, the Langwedel village museum is also not far from the place.
Olendieksau - Wildes.accessibility: on foot or by bike (if you drive on the L298 from Langwedel in the direction of Nortorf, turn left into the Moorweg opposite the Waldheim on the right)

Rabel - Wildes.name: Rabel - Wildes
Rabel - Wildes.description: This is a private place in the small village of Rabel between the Schlei and the Baltic Sea, reachable via a hiking trail through the Feldmark. A prior registration with the owners is required to sleep here. A separate toilet and shower are available. Many animals are at home here: deer, hedgehogs, foxes, squirrels, marten, bats, sparrows, cranes, eagles and eagle owls. Not far away there is the Barefoot Park and the Massholm / Oehe nature adventure center.

Schäferhaus - Wildes.name: Schäferhaus - Wildes
Schäferhaus - Wildes.description: This overnight place is offered by the Schleswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation. The site is located in the Schäferhaus foundation state, a former military training area. Tents can be pitched near the sculpture next to the famous Ochsenweg, a historic country road.

Segeberger Heide - Wildes.name: Segeberger Heide - Wildes
Segeberger Heide - Wildes.description: The Schleswig-Holstein State Forests are offering this overnight accommodation in the forest as part of the Wild Schleswig-Holstein project. In the season, a “Dixi toilet” and a garbage container are set up at the forest playground. Barbecuing is allowed.

Steinbergkirche - Wildes.name: Steinbergkirche - Wildes
Steinbergkirche - Wildes.description: This place is in a private and no longer managed farm, approx. 7 km away from the Baltic Sea and the Baltic Sea Cycle Route. The campground is located on a meadow behind the garden. By arrangement, it is possible to use an outdoor kitchen equipped with the essentials, a toilet and shower. Registration via email is mandatory.

St. Michaelisdonn - Wildes.name: St. Michaelisdonn - Wildes
St. Michaelisdonn - Wildes.description: This place of the Nature Conservation Foundation is located in a small forest in the municipality of St. Michaelisdonn. It offers a view of the Kleve nature reserve with the so-called Spiekerberg, the former edge of the North Sea (Kleve = cliff). There are hiking trails through the natural reserve. There are no seats, rubbish bins, water or sanitary facilities and fire is not allowed.

Süderlügum - Wildes.name: Süderlügum - Wildes
Süderlügum - Wildes.description: This place is in the Süderlügum youth forest, offered by the state forests in the Wild Schleswig-Holstein project. The field is located southwest of the JWH building, approx. 150 m away by a small pond. The site is open to the public.

Winderatter See - Wildes.name: Winderatter See - Wildes
Winderatter See - Wildes.description: This place is available thanks to the Schelswig-Holstein Nature Conservation Foundation. It is located in a forest, between fruit trees. A stream, the Moorau, flows by nearby. The overnight place is west to the Winderatter lake. Pastures and woods are between the lake and the overnight stay.

Camping in the Palatinate Forest.name: Palatinate Forest
Camping in the Palatinate Forest.contacts: info@suedlicheweinstrasse.de (email) 06341 940 400 (tel) - for oline booking: https://www.trekking-pfalz.de/buchung/online-buchen/? - for onsite booking: https://www.trekking-pfalz.de/de/buchung/buchungsstellen/
Camping in the Palatinate Forest.address: Franz-Hartmann-Straße 9, 67466 Lambrecht (after booking, you will receive the exact GPS data and directions to the desired location)
Camping in the Palatinate Forest.description: From April up to and including October it is possible to camp in a camp site of the Palatinate Forest Nature Park with 2-3 people for 10 euros. All places are a bit away from the villages and the usual hiking trails in areas that are harmless for nature and water protection. These places can only be reached on foot and have up to six storage spaces, a fireplace with rustic seating and a simple toilet block. The trekkers must bring water and food and take their rubbish home.

Kobach - Bayern Frankenwald.name: Kobach - Bayern Frankenwald
Kobach - Bayern Frankenwald.description: Away from the hiking and biking trails, the site is in the area of ​​the Bavarian State Forests. There is space for four tents here and wooden platforms are available for two of them. There is also a fireplace with a lighter and firewood and an outdoor toilet. Booking via the website is required and the expected price per tent is 15€ (money transfer required up to 3 days before arrival).
Kobach - Bayern Frankenwald.accessibility: on foot or by bike (arrival possible from 1:30 p.m., departure no later than 1:00 p.m.)

Rehwiese - Bayern Frankenwald.name: Rehwiese - Bayern Frankenwald
Rehwiese - Bayern Frankenwald.description: Away from the hiking and biking trails, the site is in the area of ​​the Bavarian State Forests. There is space for a total of four tents. There is also a fireplace with firewood and an outdoor toilet. Booking via the website is required and the expected price per tent is 15€ (money transfer required up to 3 days before arrival).

Döbraberg - Bayern Frankenwald.name: Döbraberg - Bayern Frankenwald
Döbraberg - Bayern Frankenwald.description: Away from the hiking and biking trails, the site is in the area of ​​the Bavarian State Forests. There is space for a total of four tents. There is also a fireplace with firewood and an outdoor toilet. Booking via the website is required and the expected price per tent is 15€ (money transfer required up to 3 days before arrival).

Spessart - Bayern.name: Spessart - Bayern
Spessart - Bayern.address: Spessart (you will receive the exact location after booking)
Spessart - Bayern.description: The sites may be used with a maximum of five tents (with 2-3 people each) and only with a valid booking confirmation with the Spessart Association via website. Please note you will only receive the exact coordinates of the tent sites (together with the invoice) after the booking.

Steigerwald - Bayern.name: Steigerwald - Bayern
Steigerwald - Bayern.address: Steigerwald (the exact address depends on the camping location chosen)
Steigerwald - Bayern.description: These places are in the Steigerwald Nature Park. A fireplace, toilet and storage space are available on each of the ten sites. You can find all trekking sites on the website. Booking is required and the expected price is 4.80€ per person.

Grimbach - Black Forest.name: Grimbach - Black Forest
Grimbach - Black Forest.description: The Grimbach Camp is located in the Baden-Baden city forest. There are small streams near the site but please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. So, it is recommended to boil the water as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Grimbach - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 670m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Malschbach - Bühlerhöhe/Plättig)

Seibelseckle - Black Forest.name: Seibelseckle - Black Forest
Seibelseckle - Black Forest.description: The Seibelseckle camp is located on the northern slope of the Kesselbach valley east of the Seibelseckle. A pooled spring with a sandstone is located on the Seibelseckle behind the rest hut. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Seibelseckle - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 863m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Seibelseckle - Mummelsee)

Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.name: Strawberry Hole - Black Forest
Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.description: The Erdbeerloch camp is located near the Erdbeerlochwiese east of Allerheiligen. A small stream crosses the camp. Please boil the water from springs before drinking it as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Strawberry Hole - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Schliffkopf - Allerheiligen)

Bösellbach - Black Forest.name: Bösellbach - Black Forest
Bösellbach - Black Forest.description: The camp is located in the forest near the Bösellbachhütte. The Bösellbach flows directly below the camp. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed so please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Bösellbach - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 766m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Refuge - Alexanderschanze)

Gutellbach - Black Forest.name: Gutellbach - Black Forest
Gutellbach - Black Forest.description: The camp is located in a side valley south of Mitteltal. It is surrounded by two streams in a small depression in the forest. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. At a distance of about 600m there is a forest hut with a barbecue area. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Gutellbach - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 640m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Mitteltal, Lamm - Refuge)

Kniebis - Black Forest.name: Kniebis - Black Forest
Kniebis - Black Forest.description: The camp is located in the Forbachtal, below the B28 in the immediate vicinity of the Forbach. The Forbach flows in the immediate vicinity of the camp. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Kniebis - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 817m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Kniebis Waldschwimmbad)

Windberg - Black Forest.name: Windberg - Black Forest
Windberg - Black Forest.address: St. Blasien (you will receive the exact GPS coordinates by email after booking)
Windberg - Black Forest.description: The camp is located north of the Windberg waterfall in St. Blasien (the exact location will be shared after the booking). A fountain and the Windbergbach spring are in the immediate vicinity of the camp. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Windberg - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 810m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: St. Blasien Albtalstraße)

Quarry - Black Forest.name: Quarry - Black Forest
Quarry - Black Forest.address: Southern Black Forest Nature Park (you will receive the exact GPS coordinates by email after booking)
Quarry - Black Forest.description: The camp is located in a small forest near the Schleifbach in Menzenschwand-Vorderdorf (the exact location will be shared after the booking). The Schleifbach is located directly at the camp with direct access. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. There is firewood to make a fire but it is only permitted in the stone fireplace onsite. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Quarry - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 876m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Menzenschwand Vorderdorf)

Felsenhalde - Black Forest.name: Felsenhalde - Black Forest
Felsenhalde - Black Forest.address: south of Dachsberg-Urberg (you will receive the exact GPS coordinates by email after booking)
Felsenhalde - Black Forest.description: The camp is located is located south of Dachsberg-Urberg (the exact location will be shared after the booking). There is a fountain that is suitable for fetching water. Please note that the springs in the Black Forest are not regularly checked for their drinking water quality. The drinking water quality cannot therefore be guaranteed. Please boil the water from springs as a precaution. Toilets are available but bring toilet paper. There is firewood to make a fire but it is only permitted in the stone fireplace onsite. At the camp there is also a small hut, which can be used as a shelter in case of very bad weather. Booking is required and the expected price is 10€ per tent. It is allowed to camp from May 1st to October 31.
Felsenhalde - Black Forest.accessibility: the trekking camps are away from the villages at a height of 905m and can only be reached on foot (closest bus stops: Urberg)
